definitions.definition: carry out or perpetrate (a mistake, crime, or immoral act).
synonyms: accomplish; Morebe responsible for; informalpull off "he committed a murder"

definitions.definition: pledge or bind (a person or an organization) to a certain course or policy.
examples: they were reluctant to commit themselves to an opinion
synonyms: dedicate "they committed themselves to the project"

definitions.definition: pledge or set aside (resources) for future use.
examples: manufacturers will have to commit substantial funds to developing new engines

definitions.definition: be in a long-term emotional relationship with (someone).

examples: we must be committed to peace

definitions.definition: send, entrust, or consign, in particular.
examples: entrust, consign, assign, deliver, give, hand over, relinquish; commend she was committed to their care

definitions.definition: consign (someone) officially to prison, especially on remand.
examples: he was committed to prison for contempt of court
synonyms: confine "the judge committed him to prison"

definitions.definition: send (a person or case) for trial.
send (someone) to be confined in a psychiatric hospital.
examples: he had been committed for treatment
synonyms: put away; certify "her husband had her committed"

definitions.definition: transfer something to (a state or place).
examples: he composed a letter but didn't commit it to paper

definitions.definition: refer (a legislative bill) to a committee.
